title: A separate study by Hart et al. believed that there was not an increase in cardiac mortality during the first missile attacks, but the paper does not provide statistics to support this supposition. title: Twelve patients undergoing routine sleep diagnostic (polysomnograph) recordings at a sleep laboratory during the war had to be awakened from sleep in order to don the gas masks at the time of the missile attacks. Once the all-clear signal was given, all were able to return to sleep within 12 minutes without any evidence of stress-related sleep disturbances
